title: No. 6 Composites Adventure Fork
content:
No. 6 Composites, the in-house brand of No. 22 Bicycles, has officially launched its Adventure Fork ($525), a fully featured offering trusted by frame builders worldwide. An earlier version of this fork was on the No. 22 Drifter Adventure that John reviewed in 2023. Let’s take a closer look…

This new fork has massive tire clearance for up to 700 x 50 mm, together with fender mounts, 3-pack accessory mounts, and internal dynamo routing make this the perfect fork for adventure. All of this packed into No. 22’s characteristic streamlined profile that seamlessly flows into the head tube (no bulging crown here) because you don’t always have to trade good looks for utility.

Specs:

  • Steerer tube length: 350mm
  • Cable routing: semi-internal entering at the top of the fork leg, or fully internal entering at the steerer
  • Rake: 50mm
  • Axle-to-crown: 398mm
  • Axle diameter: 12mm
  • Maximum tire clearance: 50mm x 700c (5mm clearance all sides), 2.3″ x 650b
  • Steerer diameter: 1-⅛” to 1-½” tapered
  • Fender mounts: Yes
  • Accessory mounts: Yes
  • Dynamo routing: Yes
  • Weight: Approximately 440g with a 350mm uncut steerer

See more at No. 6 Composites.
